title: Sinopec Launches the World's Largest Green Hydrogen-Coal Chemical Project in Inner Mongolia - PR Newswire
summary: Sinopec has launched the world's largest green hydrogen-coal chemical project in Inner Mongolia, China. The project will utilize wind and solar energy to produce green hydrogen and green oxygen. The project is expected to reduce carbon emissions by 1.43 million tons annually.
green_innovation: TRUE - The project will produce green hydrogen and green oxygen, which are environmentally friendly alternatives to fossil fuels.
business_innovation: TRUE - The project is the world's largest green hydrogen-coal chemical project and will expand China's and global green hydrogen production capacity.
green_product: TRUE - The project will produce green hydrogen and green oxygen, which are environmentally friendly alternatives to fossil fuels.
green_process: TRUE - The project will use wind and solar energy to produce green hydrogen and green oxygen, which is a more environmentally friendly process than using fossil fuels.
product_or_process: Inner Mongolia Erdos Wind-Solar Green Hydrogen Project
likely_naics_codes: ['221112 - Hydroelectric Power Generation', '221119 - Other Electric Power Generation', '325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing', '562211 - Hazardous Waste Treatment and Disposal']
greenwashing: FALSE - The project is not an example of greenwashing because it is a genuine effort to reduce carbon emissions and promote the development of the green hydrogen industry chain.
